original_conversation.content: I just got the call. [pause] Marcus is gone. [shaky voice] He overdosed last night and I... I don't understand. [exhausted] We just met on Thursday and he was doing so well, he was—God, he showed me his thirty-day chip. [very sad] He was so proud of it, you know? [sniffle] And we talked about his new job and his daughter coming to visit and I thought... [trailing off] I really thought we'd turned a corner. [frustrated] How did I miss this? Like, was there something in his voice or—I keep replaying our conversation and, um... maybe he seemed a little off? [anxious] But he always seemed a little off on Thursdays because that's when he had to see his parole officer. [crying while speaking] I should've checked in with him over the weekend. [regretful] I knew the holidays were hard for him and I just... I didn't. [pause] Seven months we've been working together. [very quietly] Seven months of Narcan training and safety planning and talking about his triggers and I thought—God, I really believed he was going to make it. [bitter] And now what, I just... start over with someone new? [upset] Pretend like Marcus didn't matter? [shaky voice] He mattered. [cry] He really mattered.

subject: Your overdose prevention client just died after you thought they were making real progress
